Package com.kewargs.cs309.core.utils.socket

Class ChatSocketClient<S extends SocketListener>

java.lang.Object
org.java_websocket.WebSocketAdapter
org.java_websocket.AbstractWebSocket
org.java_websocket.client.WebSocketClient
com.kewargs.cs309.core.utils.socket.ChatSocketClient<S>
Type Parameters:
S - The type of the listener that will handle WebSocket events for this client.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable, org.java_websocket.WebSocket, org.java_websocket.WebSocketListener
public final class ChatSocketClient<S extends SocketListener> extends org.java_websocket.client.WebSocketClient
A WebSocket client dedicated to chat functionality. It handles the setup and management of a WebSocket connection for chatting, including opening the connection, handling messages, and closing the connection. It uses a generic type S for a listener that handles the WebSocket events and actions.

    • ChatSocketClient

      public ChatSocketClient(SessionManager session, S listener)
      Constructs a ChatSocketClient using session information to authenticate and initialize connection endpoint.
      Parameters:
      session - The session manager holding authentication token and user details.
      listener - The listener that will handle WebSocket events.

    • onClose

      public void onClose(int code, String reason, boolean remote)
      Callback method that is invoked when the WebSocket connection is closed.
      Specified by:
      onClose in class org.java_websocket.client.WebSocketClient
      Parameters:
      code - The status code indicating the reason for closure.
      reason - The string explanation of why the connection closed.
      remote - Indicates if the closure was initiated by the remote host.
